unnormalised: Someone asked if online shopping is really cheaper. Well, let me tell you about my experience trying to buy a new saree for Diwali last year. I first checked out a few shops near my house in Jayanagar. The prices were around Rs. 3500 - Rs. 6000 for a silk saree I liked. I thought it was a bit steep, especially with all the Diwali expenses piling up.
normalised: Someone asked if online shopping is really cheaper. Well, let me tell you about my experience trying to buy a new saree for Diwali last year. I first checked out a few shops near my house in Jayanagar. The prices were around rupee three thousand five hundred to rupee six thousand for a silk saree I liked. I thought it was a bit steep, especially with all the Diwali expenses piling up.

unnormalised: So, I hopped online and started browsing Amazon and Myntra. To my surprise, I found almost the exact same saree for ₹ 4200 on one site and even cheaper, at ₹ 3899, after applying a coupon code on another. Plus, they had cashback offers and bank discounts that brought the price down further. After all the discounts I got it for around 3.6k! The MRP was listed as Rs 5999.
normalised: So, I hopped online and started browsing A-m-a-z-o-n and M-y-n-t-r-a. To my surprise, I found almost the exact same saree for rupee four thousand two hundred on one site and even cheaper, at rupee three thousand eight hundred and ninety nine, after applying a coupon code on another. Plus, they had cashback offers and bank discounts that brought the price down further. After all the discounts I got it for around three point six thousand! The M-R-P was listed as rupee five thousand nine hundred and ninety nine.

unnormalised: In the end, I saved around Rs. 2000 – Rs 2500 compared to buying it offline. And I got it delivered right to my doorstep on 20/10/2023. So, in my experience, for the same or similar product, online shopping can definitely be cheaper, especially if you're a savvy shopper and keep an eye out for deals and discounts. I got my saree and celebrated Diwali happily!
normalised: In the end, I saved around rupee two thousand to rupee two thousand five hundred compared to buying it offline. And I got it delivered right to my doorstep on twentieth October two thousand and twenty three. So, in my experience, for the same or similar product, online shopping can definitely be cheaper, especially if you're a savvy shopper and keep an eye out for deals and discounts. I got my saree and celebrated Diwali happily!
